extendedIngredients.name: roast beef
extendedIngredients.original: 12 ounces thinly sliced lean roast beef

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red peppers
extendedIngredients.original: 4 jarred roasted red peppers (2 ounces each), drained, rinsed, patted dry and halved
extendedIngredients.originalName: jarred roasted red peppers each), drained, rinsed, patted dry and halved

title: Roast Beef Pumpernickel Sandwich with Roasted Red Pepper, Arugula and Goat Cheese
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Roast Beef Pumpernickel Sandwich with Roasted Red Pepper, Arugulan and Goat Cheese a try. For $3.48 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 305 calories, 28g of protein, and 9g of fat. This recipe serves 4. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of balsamic vinegar, pumpernickel bread, green-leaf lettuce leaves, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 10 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is solid. Try Grilled Goat Cheese and Roasted Red Pepper Pesto Sandwich, Chicken, Roasted Red Pepper, and Goat Cheese Sandwich â€“ 8 Points, and Roasted Eggplant and Pepper Sandwich with Goat Cheese and Spinach (Meatless Monday) for similar recipes.
instructions: Spread the goat cheese on 4 slices of the bread.                                                                                                 Arrange 1 lettuce leaf on each of the 4 cheese-topped bread slices, then layer each with 3 ounces roast beef.                                                                                                 Top with red peppers, drizzle with balsamic vinegar, and cover with second slice of bread. Serve.

steps.step: Spread the goat cheese on 4 slices of the bread.
Arrange 1 lettuce leaf on each of the 4 cheese-topped bread slices, then layer each with 3 ounces roast beef.
Top with red peppers, drizzle with balsamic vinegar, and cover with second slice of bread.
